name: Fried Liver
description: Fried liver is a dish made from liver, typically from beef, pork, or chicken, that is fried. It can be served with a variety of sides, such as mashed potatoes, vegetables, or gravy.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste)
instructions: Prepare the Liver: Remove any visible veins or membranes from the liver. Cut the liver into bite-sized pieces.

Marinate the Liver: In a bowl, combine the liver pieces with the chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to ensure the liver is evenly coated with the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.

Cook the Liver: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the marinated liver pieces and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are browned on all sides and cooked through. This should take about 10-15 minutes. Once the liver is cooked, remove it from the pan and set aside.
Serve: Garnish the cooked liver with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with a side of ugali (Kenyan cornmeal porridge), rice, or chapati.
